description:
html: avoid func compare

The comparisons are in useTheRulesFor.
There may be a less intrusive way to work
around them.

messages.text:
On 13 November 2011 05:09,  <andybalholm@gmail.com> wrote:
> One alternative would be to have an insertionMode field in the parser,
> and have the insertion mode functions change that when they need to
> change to a different insertion mode. Then they would just return bool
> (for whether the token was consumed).
> useTheRulesFor would not be needed.
>
> See my alternate CL at http://codereview.appspot.com/5372079
>
> http://codereview.appspot.com/5372078/

Yes, let's go with Andy's CL. It's closer to what html5lib does.

Hello nigeltao (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg

One alternative would be to have an insertionMode field in the parser, and have the insertion mode functions change that when they need to change to a different insertion mode. Then they would just return bool (for whether the token was consumed).
useTheRulesFor would not be needed.

See my alternate CL at http://codereview.appspot.com/5372079

subject: code review 5372078: html: avoid func compare
